Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: Organizes styles that will be applied to other controls. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet> control can contain any number of style objects, or more specialized style objects that inherit from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style> class. These should have unique name properties. You can then refer to other controls on the same page by their <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.Name%2A> property. This class has no visual representation.
A page can also use an external style sheet, and several pages can share the same external style sheet. For more information about styles, refer to the [\<style>](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/0048ce21-2c92-4377-a211-9aca9efdf748) element and the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet.Styles%2A> topic.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet> control ignores its own style attributes; setting a style attribute on the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet> itself has no effect on the styles contained as children within the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet> control.
## Examples The following example shows how you can add Style properties to a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet> control during the `Page_Load` event.
[!code-aspx-csharp[MobileStyleSheetSample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobileStyleSheetSample/cs/Default.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[MobileStyleSheetSample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobileStyleSheetSample/vb/Default.aspx#1)]

Docs.permission: for operating in a hosted environment. Demand value: ; Permission value: .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the background color for the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.value: The specified background color for the style.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Unlike the other properties, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet.BackColor%2A> property is not inherited from its parent. For example, if you set the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet.BackColor%2A> property to cyan on a parent control, a child control will not inherit the background color of cyan. You must explicitly set the child control's <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet.BackColor%2A> property to cyan, or you must set the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet.BackColor%2A> property of the parent control and apply the style sheet to the child control. This is consistent with the behavior of cascading style sheets.

Docs.exception:
The property was accessed at run time.
-or-
An attempt was made to set the property.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a property that determines whether an additional trailing break is rendered after the control. This break causes subsequent content to start on the next line. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.value: if an additional trailing break is rendered after the control; otherwise, . The default is .

.method public hidebysig instance void Clear() cil managed
Public Sub Clear ()
public: void Clear();
member this.Clear : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Clears the collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is not available in the read-only <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IObjectListFieldCollection> interface.
You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet.Clear%2A> method for all the classes where this method applies. For example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet.Clear%2A> method for a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet> collection clears all the styles in the collection; or for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DeviceSpecificChoiceCollection>, it clears all the choices in the collection.
Adding a field to the fields of an object list changes the data-binding behavior of the control, and requires you to bind data to the control again.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a reference to a user control (.ascx file). The default value is . This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.value: A reference to a user control (.ascx file).

remarks.format: ## Remarks The style sheet on the page inherits the styles in a style sheet defined at the root level of the referenced user control. For example, if the style sheet on the user control has a property named `Style1`, the page can access `Style1` as if it were in the style sheet on the page.
